intro: Chrysocyathus sutchuensis, commonly known as the Sutchuensis sea anemone, is a unique marine invertebrate belonging to the family Cyathidae. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent polyps and vibrant coloration, which can range from yellow to orange. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches itself to rocky substrates. Its morphology includes a central gastrovascular cavity surrounded by multiple tentacles used for capturing prey. Chrysocyathus sutchuensis plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the food web and providing habitat for smaller organisms.
